column2: 1. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column4: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.

column2: 5. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column4: from a one-way street into a one-way street.
column8: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.

column2: 7. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column6: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.
column8: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.

column2: 8. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.
column6: Wait for the next green light.
column10: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.
that there's a school zone ahead.

column2: 10. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.
column6: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.
column8: must make a U-turn and then turn right.
column10: can turn left. You have the right of way.

column4: Trucks have the right of way

column10: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 13. If a bus has signaled and is pulling back onto the roadway, you must:
column10: honk to let them know you’re there.

column2: 14. When driving in icy or snowy conditions, to avoid crashes drivers should:
column4: get off the highway as quickly as possible.
column6: engage 4 wheel drive on the vehicle.
column8: add extra weight to the vehicle to improve traction.
column10: reduce speed and increase following distance.

column2: 15. When parking downhill next to a curb, you should turn your front wheels:

column8: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column10: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

column8: may cause you to hydroplane even with very little water on the road.

column2: 18. What happens if two vehicles reach at the same time an intersection with four-way stop signs?
column4: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column8: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left.
column10: The first vehicle to reach the intersection must yield.

column8: show which lanes you must use.
column10: indicate that you can not pass or change lanes.

column2: 20. The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
21. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.
column6: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.
column8: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.

column2: 23. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?

column10: A road joins from the right

column2: 25. An octagonal sign means that drivers must:
column4: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
